speaker: Nina
text: I’ve been staring at this code for hours and still can’t figure out what’s wrong with the caching layer.
ipa: aɪv bɪn ˈsteərɪŋ æt ðɪs kəʊd fɔː ˈaʊəz ənd stɪl kɑːnt ˈfɪɡər aʊt wɒts rɒŋ wɪð ðə ˈkæʃɪŋ ˈleɪə.
stress: I'VE been STARING at this CODE for HOURS and STILL CAN'T FIGURE OUT what's WRONG with the CACHING LAYER.

speaker: Eric
text: Let me take a look. You know, this reminds me of the issue we had last quarter — with the stale object references?
ipa: lɛt mi teɪk ə lʊk. ju nəʊ, ðɪs rɪˈmaɪndz mi əv ði ˈɪʃuː wi hæd lɑːst ˈkwɔːtə — wɪð ðə steɪl ˈɒbdʒɪkt ˈrɛfərənsɪz?
stress: LET me TAKE a LOOK. YOU KNOW, this REMINDS me of the ISSUE we HAD last QUARTER — with the STALE OBJECT REFERENCES?

speaker: Nina
text: Oh right! I had almost forgotten about that. We dealt with it by refactoring some of the shared context logic.
ipa: əʊ raɪt! aɪ hæd ˈɔːlməʊst fəˈɡɒtn əˈbaʊt ðæt. wi dɛlt wɪð ɪt baɪ riːˈfæktərɪŋ sʌm əv ðə ʃeəd ˈkɒntekst ˈlɒdʒɪk.
stress: OH RIGHT! I had ALMOST FORGOTTEN about THAT. We DEALT with it by REFACTORING some of the SHARED CONTEXT LOGIC.

speaker: Eric
text: Exactly. Also, I talked to DevOps earlier — they mentioned some suspicious latency spikes in the Redis instance.
ipa: ɪɡˈzæktli. ˈɔːlsəʊ, aɪ tɔːkt tu ˈdɛvɒps ˈɜːliə — ðeɪ ˈmɛnʃənd səm səˈspɪʃəs ˈleɪtənsi spaɪks ɪn ðə ˈrɛdɪs ˈɪnstəns.
stress: EXACTLY. ALSO, I TALKED to DEVOPS EARLIER — they MENTIONED some SUSPICIOUS LATENCY SPIKES in the REDIS INSTANCE.

speaker: Nina
text: Wait, that might be it! Could you present this to the team tomorrow morning? I don’t think everyone’s aware of it.
ipa: weɪt, ðæt maɪt bi ɪt! kʊd ju prɪˈzɛnt ðɪs tu ðə tiːm təˈmɒrəʊ ˈmɔːnɪŋ? aɪ dəʊnt θɪŋk ˈɛvrɪwʌnz əˈweər əv ɪt.
stress: WAIT, that MIGHT be IT! COULD you PRESENT this to the TEAM TOMORROW MORNING? I DON'T THINK EVERYONE'S AWARE of it.

speaker: Eric
text: Sure. I’m also planning to write to the vendor to check if we need an upgrade. We’re already at 75% capacity.
ipa: ʃʊə. aɪm ˈɔːlsəʊ ˈplænɪŋ tu raɪt tu ðə ˈvɛndə tu ʧɛk ɪf wi niːd ən ˈʌpɡreɪd. wɪr ɔːlˈrɛdi æt ˈsɛvnti faɪv pəˈsɛnt kəˈpæsɪti.
stress: SURE. I'M ALSO PLANNING to WRITE to the VENDOR to CHECK if we NEED an UPGRADE. WE'RE ALREADY at 75% CAPACITY.

speaker: Nina
text: Yeah, I’ve been concerned about that for weeks. It’s one of those bottlenecks that could become a big problem if we don’t act soon.
ipa: jæ, aɪv bɪn kənˈsɜːnd əˈbaʊt ðæt fɔː wiːks. ɪts wʌn əv ðəʊz ˈbɒtlˌnɛks ðæt kʊd bɪˈkʌm ə bɪɡ ˈprɒbləm ɪf wi dəʊnt ækt suːn.
stress: YEAH, I'VE been CONCERNED about THAT for WEEKS. IT'S one of those BOTTLENECKS that COULD become a BIG PROBLEM if we DON'T ACT SOON.

speaker: Eric
text: I agree with you completely. Let’s rely on some monitoring tonight and see what else pops up.
ipa: aɪ əˈɡriː wɪð ju kəmˈpliːtli. lɛts rɪˈlaɪ ɒn səm ˈmɒnɪtərɪŋ təˈnaɪt ənd siː wɒt ɛls pɒps ʌp.
stress: I AGREE with YOU COMPLETELY. LET'S RELY on some MONITORING TONIGHT and SEE what ELSE POPS UP.

speaker: Nina
text: Alright. I’ll keep working on this fallback mechanism while you do that. Just call me if anything weird shows up.
ipa: ɔːlˈraɪt. aɪl kiːp ˈwɜːkɪŋ ɒn ðɪs ˈfɔːlbæk ˈmɛkənɪzəm waɪl ju duː ðæt. ʤʌst kɔːl mi ɪf ˈɛnɪθɪŋ wɪəd ʃəʊz ʌp.
stress: ALRIGHT. I'LL KEEP WORKING on this FALLBACK MECHANISM while YOU DO THAT. JUST CALL ME if ANYTHING WEIRD SHOWS UP.

speaker: Eric
text: Will do. This is one of those bugs that really gets you in deep, huh?
ipa: wɪl duː. ðɪs ɪz wʌn əv ðəʊz bʌɡz ðæt ˈrɪəli ɡɛts ju ɪn diːp, hʌ?
stress: WILL DO. THIS is ONE of those BUGS that REALLY GETS YOU in DEEP, huh?

speaker: Nina
text: Definitely. But hey, that’s what makes it fun — sometimes.
ipa: ˈdɛfɪnətli. bət heɪ, ðæts wɒt meɪks ɪt fʌn — ˈsʌmtaɪmz.
stress: DEFINITELY. BUT HEY, THAT'S what MAKES it FUN — SOMETIMES.
